name: 黃有評
objective: The use of probability models and statistical methods for analyzing data has become common practice in virtually all scientific disciplines. This course attempts to provide a comprehensive introduction to those models and methods most likely to be encountered and used by students in their careers in engineering and the sciences.
schedule:
1. Overview
2. Probability
3~4. Discrete random variables and probability distributions
5~6. Continuous random variables and probability distributions
7~8. Joint probability distributions and random samples
9~10. The analysis of variance
11~12. Multifactor analysis of variance
13~14. Simple linear regression and correlation
15~16. Nonlinear and multiple regression
17~18. Goodness-of-fit tests and categorical data analysis
scorePolicy:
1. Mid-term exam.: 30%
2. Final exam.: 30%
3. Homeworks+ quizzes+ others: 40%
materials:
1. Textbook: Jay L. Devore, Probability and Statistics for Engineering and the Sciences, 7th Ed., Thomson Brooks/Cole, 2008, 華泰文化代理
2. Homeworks solutions: http://iseco.idv.tw/yphuang/
